channel.title: White lines all over my screen
channel.description:
Hi guys, today i bought black mesa on steam and upon opening the game i notice lots of white lines, ive tried to look around online for a solution but nothing so far has worked, any help would be much appreciated, thanks.
[url]https://images.akamai.steamusercontent.com/ugc/262714717787822138/DF4FBCA4FB748F6EBCAA3BC49F5CB8EBF79F2EFB/[/url]
System spec is:
Geforce gtx 750 Ti
AMD Fx(tm)-4100 Quad-Core Processor
16GB RAM
All drivers up to date.

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: chetanjags
item.description:
Darkc0re1:

Still no luck, proper gutted, i really wanted to play this game…

Please let us know if you are still facing the issue after our recent hot fixes.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Flavrans
item.description:
bkdale86:

Our programmer said exec.

Then I apologize.

In any case, the -autoconfig launch option will make a Source Engine game (including Black Mesa I assume) reset its video and performance settings to default for the current hardware detected and ignore settings in any .cfg files. It’s documented here and here.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: bkdale86
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Cpl.1nsane
item.description:
What OS are you running out of interest? Are you seeing any red error messages in the console? (default key is ` which is directly below the ESC key and to the left of you 1 key on your keyboard) you can also add -condebug[/size] to your launch options which will create a log text file in your \Steam\steamapps\common\Black Mesa\bms\ folder called console.log (this can be opened in any text editor like notepad) if you can attach that file once you’ve opened up the game and closed it again that would be helpful. Thanks

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Flavrans
item.description:
I think @bkdale86 meant [tt]-autoconfig[/tt]

Also, try resetting the video driver settings to defaults in the NVIDIA control panel.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
Uninstall and unsubscribe from ALL mods then

Go to ***\SteamApps\workshop\content\362890 (where *** is the location to where your steam games may be)
and Delete all folders within this folder

Verify the Game Cache

Restart the computer.

If that does not fix it uninstall Black Mesa, restart the computer and reinstall the game.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: RedEye
item.description:
Just in case you really corrupted the games config file you could try this.

Go into SteamApps/Black Mesa/bms/cfg, and delete “config.cfg”.
The game will recreate the file when it starts.

From a dev, post #5 https://steamcommunity.com/app/362890/discussions/0/358415738199969778/#c358415738215796417

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Agent6
item.description:
The only other time I’ve seen something that kinda resembled this was by setting the game on a lower and unsupported version of DirectX.

Don’t know how would this happen in your case judging after the specs but, try putting in Black Mesa’s Lauch Settings -dxlevel95 (or 90) and see what happens.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Darkc0re1
item.description:
Hi guys, ive tried many different graphics settings and it makes no difference whatsoever.

it does indeed look like i’m in wireframe mode but i’ve tried that command in the console and it doesn’t do anything.

Read full topic
item.source: White lines all over my screen

item.title: White lines all over my screen
item.dc:creator: Jack_Freeman
item.description:
Looks like you have wireframe mode on (I think?)
Type “mat_wireframe 0” in the console.

Read full topic
